channel.title: Lol wid me
channel.description:
http://www.rfcexpress.com/lawsuit.asp?id=54090 http://dockets.justia.com/docket/court-madce/case_no-1:2010cv10216/case_id-127089/
Are the cases that I pasted earlier on IRC and the below are all copies of the brief, thanks to sexemplar for the original and c|p for the mirror.
http://206.217.212.169/~cowie/RSDocuments/jagex_vs_impulse_software.pdf http://s11.info/c/papers/jagex_ltd_vs_impulse_software.pdf http://file.upinthisbit.ch/d177655e_CJ1010216I.pdf
So ruler, I heard you are [b]fucked.[/b]

item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

lmao.

Knew this was coming eventually. Yet another reason for keeping everything I do completely private.

If they sue those morons for the little they’ve done, they’ll put a hit out on me and wL and Evo for the stuff we’ve done…

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Mopman:

right. you were the one that brought up extradition, not me…

Read Mopar’s original post again, the one quoting the TOS fragment. It reads as if Jagex expects other countries to extradite people so that they can be tried in Britain.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

right. you were the one that brought up extradition, not me…

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:96, topic:328973”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=425358.msg3129299#msg3129299 date=1266295304]
Sounds like a very egotistical thing to write given that it’s a company that crosses national boundaries; I can’t believe they had the audacity to believe that a country such as America would extradite people so that they could be sued in a British court, rofl.
[/quote]

Yet it’s perfectly fine when the Americans expect us to extradite mentally ill people so they can be tried in an American court?

You guys are really bad at law, btw. Even worse than me, and that’s saying something.[/quote]
We’re not talking criminal law here. We’re talking about a lawsuit.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It seems to me it means that they can sue/prosecute you if you go to the UK, but the TOS doesn’t apply elsewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:90, topic:328973”]I just noticed a very interesting clause at the bottom of jagex’s TOS:

These terms and conditions are governed by English law and any dispute connected with them or Jagex Products will be decided only by the courts of the United Kingdom.

What exactly does that mean for a case tried in the USA?[/quote]
It doesn’t mean anything.

Some British people can be notoriously snobbish when it comes to dealing with people in other parts of the world (notably some, not all).
Sounds like a very egotistical thing to write given that it’s a company that crosses national boundaries; I can’t believe they had the audacity to believe that a country such as America would extradite people so that they could be sued in a British court, rofl.

High time that the Gowers realised that Britain doesn’t run the world anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just noticed a very interesting clause at the bottom of jagex’s TOS:

These terms and conditions are governed by English law and any dispute connected with them or Jagex Products will be decided only by the courts of the United Kingdom.

What exactly does that mean for a case tried in the USA?

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

eXemplar:

[quote]eXemplar, yeah ISPs cut your bandwidth, limit you, and do drop your service! Get out from your parents basement and you would know that.

No, they don’t, maybe if you got out of your parents basement and stopped wearing tinfoil hats, you would realise this.

Hell, they even won a court case here that says ISPs dont have to do jack shit without a court order.[/quote]
God bless the Australian courts, the only sane part of our legal system. Minister Conjob is going to probably legislate though, completely undermining the integrity of the court’s decision – so much for checks and balances.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me

eXemplar, yeah ISPs cut your bandwidth, limit you, and do drop your service! Get out from your parents basement and you would know that.
No, they don't, maybe if you got out of your parents basement and stopped wearing tinfoil hats, you would realise this.

Hell, they even won a court case here that says ISPs dont have to do jack shit without a court order.

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:80, topic:328973”]http://rs-hacking.com/

And that’s the end of that story.

Mopar, you’re next…[/quote]

this may sound naive but can’t you just get a host who “isn’t a pussy”? Like one of those in an illegitimate country. Or does it “just not work like that” or is it too expensive :@. I wonder how the “you broke our TOS so we broke yours” angle is going to hold up in court.

Read full topic

item.title: Lol wid me
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:82, topic:328973”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=425358.msg3125688#msg3125688 date=1266012436]

http://rs-hacking.com/

And that’s the end of that story.

Mopar, you’re next…

Your website was home to several bot development projects, right? This is mostly just discussion of cheating.
[/quote]

It was, though nothing they had access to was actually anything substantial that could be harmful to them… However, my hosting company is trying to put me in contact with Jagex, I’m going to try to negotiate terms to continue my community, as the point of it has always been educational…[/quote]
Well I wish you well, but you know who you’re dealing with.

Read full topic
